intro: Tryphostemma natalense, commonly known as Natal star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its attractive, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has opposite, simple leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
